ca.weblite.pisces

Class Graphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.weblite.pisces.Graphics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Graphics
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    Pisces user interface. Most operations pass through the graphics pipeline including stroking and filling and transformations. Blit operations skip the pipeline and pass directly into the pixel blender and onto the surface (framebuffer). The blit pixels include transparency for blending into the surface, but subpixel sampling for antialiasing is not performed.
    See Also:
    Path, Polygon

      • setStroke

        public final Graphics setStroke(double lineWidth,
                 int capStyle,
                 int joinStyle,
                 double miterLimit,
                 double[] dashArray,
                 double dashPhase)
        Sets the current stroke parameters.
        Parameters:
        lineWidth - the sroke width
        capStyle - the line cap style, one of Stroker.CAP_*.
        joinStyle - the line cap style, one of Stroker.JOIN_*.
        miterLimit - the stroke miter limit
        dashArray - an int array containing the dash segment lengths in S15.16 format, or null.
        dashPhase - the starting dash offset, in S15.16 format.
        Returns:
        Self for chaining.

        public final Graphics close()
        Close a path by emitting a line from the last point "pen down" (e.g. last lineTo) to the last point "pen up" (last moveTo).
